   19: %%
   20: -module(misc_inline_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   25: 	 tobias/1,empty_string/1,md5/1,silly_coverage/1,
   26: 	 confused_literals/1,integer_encoding/0,integer_encoding/1,
   27: 	 override_bif/1]).
   28: 	 
   29: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   30: 
   31: %% For the override_bif testcase.
   32: %% NB, no other testcases in this testsuite can use these without erlang:prefix!
   33: -compile({no_auto_import,[abs/1]}).
   34: -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/3]}).
   35: -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
   36: -import(test_lib,[binary_part/2]).
   37: 
   38: %% This should do no harm (except for fun byte_size/1 which does not, by design, work with import
   39: -compile({no_auto_import,[byte_size/1]}).
   40: -import(erlang,[byte_size/1]).
   41: 
   42: %% Cover the code for callback handling.
   43: -callback must_define_this_one() -> 'ok'.
   44: -callback do_something_strange(atom()) -> 'ok'.
   45: -optional_callbacks([do_something_strange/1]).
   46: -optional_callbacks([ignore_me]).		%Invalid; ignored.
   47: 
   48: %% Include an opaque declaration to cover the stripping of
   49: %% opaque types from attributes in v3_kernel.
   50: -opaque misc_SUITE_test_cases() :: [atom()].
   51: 
   52: %% Cover handling of the `nifs` attribute.
   53: -nifs([all/0]).
   54: 
   55: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   56:     Config.
   57: 
   58: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   59:     ok.
   60: 
   61: suite() ->
   62:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   63:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   64: 
   65: -spec all() -> misc_SUITE_test_cases().
   66: all() -> 
   67:     slow_group() ++ [{group,p}].
   68: 
   69: groups() -> 
   70:     [{p,[parallel],
   71:       [tobias,empty_string,silly_coverage,
   72:        confused_literals,override_bif]},
   73:      {slow,[parallel],[integer_encoding,md5]}].
   74: 
   75: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   76:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   77:     if
   78:         is_atom(Config) ->
   79:             %% Cover handling of load_nif. Will never actually be called.
   80:             _ = erlang:load_nif("no_real_nif", 42);
   81:         true ->
   82:             ok
   83:     end,
   84:     Config.
   85: 
   86: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   87:     ok.
   88: 
   89: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   90:     Config.
   91: 
   92: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   93:     Config.
   94: 
   95: slow_group() ->
   96:     case ?MODULE of
   97: 	misc_SUITE ->
   98:             %% Canononical module name. Run slow cases.
   99:             [{group,slow}];
  100:         _ ->
  101:             %% Cloned module. Don't run.
  102:             []
  103:     end.
  104:     
  105: %%
  106: %% Functions that override new and old bif's
  107: %%
  108: abs(_N) ->
  109:     dummy_abs.
  110: 
  111: binary_part(_,_,_) ->
  112:     dummy_bp.
  113: 
  114: %% Test that local functions and imports override auto-imported BIFs.
  115: override_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  116:     dummy_abs = abs(1),
  117:     dummy_bp = binary_part(<<"hello">>,1,1),
  118:     dummy = binary_part(<<"hello">>,{1,1}),
  119:     1 = erlang:abs(1),
  120:     <<"e">> = erlang:binary_part(<<"hello">>,1,1),
  121:     <<"e">> = erlang:binary_part(<<"hello">>,{1,1}),
  122:     F = fun(X) when byte_size(X) =:= 4 ->
  123: 		four;
  124: 	   (X) ->
  125: 		byte_size(X)
  126: 	end,
  127:     four = F(<<1,2,3,4>>),
  128:     5 = F(<<1,2,3,4,5>>),
  129:     ok.
  130: 
  131: %% A bug reported by Tobias Lindahl for a development version of R11B.
  132: 
  133: tobias(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     1 = tobias_1([1,2,3]),
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: tobias_1([H|_T]) ->
  138:     %% In an R11B compiler, the move optimizer in beam_block would
  139:     %% confuse H and _T.
  140:     tobias_2(0, 0),
  141:     H.
  142: 
  143: tobias_2(_, _) ->
  144:     2.
  145: 
  146: 
  147: %% A bug reported by Richard Carlsson. Used to crash beam_asm
  148: %% because of a put_string instruction with an empty string.
  149: %% The real problem was in sys_core_fold (empty strings should
  150: %% be replaced by []).
  151: 
  152: -record(r, {s = ""}).
  153: 
  154: empty_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  155:     #r{s="x"} = empty_string_1(#r{}),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: empty_string_1(T) ->
  159:     case T of
  160: 	#r{s = ""} -> T #r{s = "x"}
  161:     end.
  162: 
  163: md5(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  165:     Beams = filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*.beam")),
  166:     io:format("Found ~w beam files", [length(Beams)]),
  167:     lists:foreach(fun md5_1/1, Beams).
  168: 
  169: md5_1(Beam) ->
  170:     {ok,{Mod,[Vsn]}} = beam_lib:version(Beam),
  171:     {ok,Code} = file:read_file(Beam),
  172:     {Mod,<<Vsn:128>>} = {Mod,code:module_md5(Code)}.
  173: 
  174: %% Cover some code that handles internal errors.
  175: 
  176: silly_coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  177:     %% v3_core
  178:     BadAbstr = [{attribute,0,module,bad_module},
  179:                 {function,0,foo,2,[bad_clauses]}],
  180:     expect_error(fun() -> v3_core:module(BadAbstr, []) end),
  181: 
  182:     %% sys_core_fold, sys_core_alias, sys_core_bsm, beam_core_to_ssa
  183:     BadCoreErlang = {c_module,[],
  184: 		     {c_literal,[],name},[],[],
  185: 		     [{{c_var,[],{foo,2}},seriously_bad_body}]},
  186:     expect_error(fun() -> sys_core_fold:module(BadCoreErlang, []) end),
  187:     expect_error(fun() -> sys_core_alias:module(BadCoreErlang, []) end),
  188:     expect_error(fun() -> sys_core_bsm:module(BadCoreErlang, []) end),
  189:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_core_to_ssa:module(BadCoreErlang, []) end),
  190: 
  191:     %% beam_ssa_lint
  192:     %% beam_ssa_bool
  193:     %% beam_ssa_recv
  194:     %% beam_ssa_share
  195:     %% beam_ssa_pre_codegen
  196:     %% beam_ssa_codegen
  197:     BadSSA = {b_module,#{},a,b,c,
  198:               [{b_function,#{func_info=>{mod,foo,0}},args,bad_blocks,0}]},
  199:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_lint:module(BadSSA, []) end),
  200:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_bool:module(BadSSA, []) end),
  201:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_recv:module(BadSSA, []) end),
  202:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_share:module(BadSSA, []) end),
  203:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_pre_codegen:module(BadSSA, []) end),
  204:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_codegen:module(BadSSA, []) end),
  205: 
  206:     %% beam_ssa_opt
  207:     BadSSABlocks = #{0 => {b_blk,#{},[bad_code],{b_ret,#{},arg}}},
  208:     BadSSAOpt = {b_module,#{},a,[],[],
  209:                  [{b_function,#{func_info=>{mod,foo,0}},[],
  210:                    BadSSABlocks,0}]},
  211:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_opt:module(BadSSAOpt, []) end),
  212: 
  213:     %% beam_ssa_bc_size
  214:     cover_beam_ssa_bc_size(1),
  215: 
  216:     %% beam_ssa_lint, beam_ssa_pp
  217:     {error,[{_,Errors}]} = beam_ssa_lint:module(bad_ssa_lint_input(), []),
  218:     _ = [io:put_chars(Mod:format_error(Reason)) ||
  219:             {Mod,Reason} <- Errors],
  220: 
  221:     %% Cover printing of annotations in beam_ssa_pp
  222:     PPAnno = #{func_info=>{mod,foo,0},other_anno=>value,map_anno=>#{k=>v}},
  223:     PPBlocks = #{0=>{b_blk,#{},[],{b_ret,#{},{b_literal,42}}}},
  224:     PP = {b_function,PPAnno,[],PPBlocks,0},
  225:     io:put_chars(beam_ssa_pp:format_function(PP)),
  226: 
  227:     %% beam_a
  228:     BeamAInput = {?MODULE,[{foo,0}],[],
  229: 		  [{function,foo,0,2,
  230: 		    [{label,1},
  231: 		     {func_info,{atom,?MODULE},{atom,foo},0},
  232: 		     {label,2}|non_proper_list]}],99},
  233:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_a:module(BeamAInput, []) end),
  234: 
  235:     %% beam_block
  236:     BlockInput = {?MODULE,[{foo,0}],[],
  237: 		  [{function,foo,0,2,
  238: 		    [{label,1},
  239: 		     {func_info,{atom,?MODULE},{atom,foo},0},
  240: 		     {label,2}|non_proper_list]}],99},
  241:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_block:module(BlockInput, []) end),
  242: 
  243:     %% beam_jump
  244:     JumpInput = BlockInput,
  245:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_jump:module(JumpInput, []) end),
  246: 
  247:     %% beam_clean
  248:     CleanInput = {?MODULE,[{foo,0}],[],
  249: 		  [{function,foo,0,2,
  250: 		    [{label,1},
  251: 		     {func_info,{atom,?MODULE},{atom,foo},0},
  252: 		     {label,2},
  253: 		     {jump,{f,42}}]}],99},
  254:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_clean:module(CleanInput, []) end),
  255: 
  256:     %% beam_jump
  257:     TrimInput = BlockInput,
  258:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_trim:module(TrimInput, []) end),
  259: 
  260:     BeamZInput = {?MODULE,[{foo,0}],[],
  261: 		  [{function,foo,0,2,
  262: 		    [{label,1},
  263: 		     {func_info,{atom,?MODULE},{atom,foo},0},
  264: 		     {label,2}|non_proper_list]}],99},
  265:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_z:module(BeamZInput, []) end),
  266: 
  267:     %% beam_validator.
  268:     BeamValInput = {?MODULE,[{foo,0}],[],
  269: 		    [{function,foo,0,2,
  270: 		      [{label,1},
  271: 		       {func_info,{atom,?MODULE},{atom,foo},0},
  272: 		       {label,2}|non_proper_list]}],99},
  273:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_validator:validate(BeamValInput, strong) end),
  274: 
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: cover_beam_ssa_bc_size(20) ->
  278:     ok;
  279: cover_beam_ssa_bc_size(N) ->
  280:     BcSizeKey = {b_local,{b_literal,name},1},
  281:     %% Try different sizes for the opt_st record.
  282:     OptSt = erlang:make_tuple(N, #{}, [{1,opt_st}]),
  283:     expect_error(fun() -> beam_ssa_bc_size:opt(#{BcSizeKey => OptSt}) end),
  284:     cover_beam_ssa_bc_size(N + 1).
  285: 
  286: bad_ssa_lint_input() ->
  287:     Ret = {b_var,100},
  288:     {b_module,#{},t,
  289:      [{a,1},{b,1},{c,1},{module_info,0},{module_info,1}],
  290:      [],
  291:      [{b_function,
  292:        #{func_info => {t,a,1},location => {"t.erl",4}},
  293:        [{b_var,0}],
  294:        #{0 => {b_blk,#{},[],{b_ret,#{},{b_var,'@undefined_var'}}}},
  295:        3},
  296:       {b_function,
  297:        #{func_info => {t,b,1},location => {"t.erl",5}},
  298:        [{b_var,0}],
  299:        #{0 =>
  300:              {b_blk,#{},
  301:               [{b_set,#{},{b_var,'@first_var'},first_op,[]},
  302:                {b_set,#{},{b_var,'@second_var'},second_op,[]},
  303:                {b_set,#{},{b_var,'@ret'},succeeded,[{b_var,'@first_var'}]}],
  304:               {b_ret,#{},{b_var,'@ret'}}}},
  305:        3},
  306:       {b_function,
  307:        #{func_info => {t,c,1},location => {"t.erl",6}},
  308:        [{b_var,0}],
  309:        #{0 =>
  310:              {b_blk,#{},
  311:               [{b_set,#{},{b_var,'@first_var'},first_op,[]},
  312:                {b_set,#{},{b_var,'@ret'},succeeded,[{b_var,'@first_var'}]},
  313:                {b_set,#{},{b_var,'@second_var'},second_op,[]}],
  314:               {b_ret,#{},{b_var,'@ret'}}}},
  315:        3},
  316:       {b_function,
  317:        #{func_info => {t,module_info,0}},
  318:        [],
  319:        #{0 =>
  320:              {b_blk,#{},
  321:               [{b_set,#{},
  322:                 Ret,
  323:                 call,
  324:                 [{b_remote,
  325:                   {b_literal,erlang},
  326:                   {b_literal,get_module_info},
  327:                   1},
  328:                  {b_var,'@unknown_variable'}]}],
  329:               {b_ret,#{},Ret}}},
  330:        4}]}.
  331: 
  332: expect_error(Fun) ->
  333:     try	Fun() of
  334: 	Any ->
  335: 	    io:format("~p", [Any]),
  336: 	    ct:fail(call_was_supposed_to_fail)
  337:     catch
  338: 	Class:Reason:Stk ->
  339: 	    io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Reason,Stk]),
  340: 	    case {Class,Reason} of
  341: 		{error,undef} ->
  342: 		    ct:fail(not_supposed_to_fail_with_undef);
  343: 		{_,_} ->
  344: 		    ok
  345: 	    end
  346:     end.
  347: 
  348: confused_literals(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  349:     {0,infinity} = confused_literals_1(int),
  350:     {0.0,infinity} = confused_literals_1(float),
  351:     ok.
  352: 
  353: confused_literals_1(int) -> {0,infinity};
  354: confused_literals_1(float) -> {0.0,infinity}.
  355: 
  356: integer_encoding() ->
  357:     [{timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
  358: 
  359: integer_encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  360:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  361:     SrcFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "misc_SUITE_integer_encoding.erl"),
  362:     DataFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "integer_encoding.data"),
  363:     Mod = misc_SUITE_integer_encoding,
  364: 
  365:     %% Create files.
  366:     {ok,Src} = file:open(SrcFile, [write]),
  367:     {ok,Data} = file:open(DataFile, [write]),
  368:     io:format(Src, "-module(~s).\n", [Mod]),
  369:     io:put_chars(Src, "-export([t/1]).\n"),
  370:     io:put_chars(Src, "t(Last) ->[\n"),
  371:     io:put_chars(Data, "[\n"),
  372: 
  373:     do_integer_encoding(137, 0, Src, Data),
  374:     _ = [begin
  375: 	     B = 1 bsl I,
  376: 	     do_integer_encoding(-B-1, Src, Data),
  377: 	     do_integer_encoding(-B, Src, Data),
  378: 	     do_integer_encoding(-B+1, Src, Data),
  379: 	     do_integer_encoding(B-1, Src, Data),
  380: 	     do_integer_encoding(B, Src, Data),
  381: 	     do_integer_encoding(B+1, Src, Data)
  382: 	 end || I <- lists:seq(1, 130)],
  383:     io:put_chars(Src, "Last].\n\n"),
  384:     ok = file:close(Src),
  385:     io:put_chars(Data, "0].\n\n"),
  386:     ok = file:close(Data),
  387: 
  388:     %% Compile and load Erlang module.
  389:     SrcRoot = filename:rootname(SrcFile),
  390:     {ok,Mod,Binary} = compile:file(SrcRoot, [binary,report]),
  391:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, SrcRoot, Binary),
  392: 
  393:     %% Compare lists.
  394:     List = Mod:t(0),
  395:     {ok,[List]} = file:consult(DataFile),
  396: 
  397:     %% Cleanup.
  398:     file:delete(SrcFile),
  399:     file:delete(DataFile),
  400:     ok.
  401: 
  402: do_integer_encoding(0, _, _, _) -> ok;
  403: do_integer_encoding(N, I0, Src, Data) ->
  404:     I1 = (I0 bsl 5) bor (rand:uniform(32) - 1),
  405:     do_integer_encoding(I1, Src, Data),
  406:     I2 = -(I1 bxor (rand:uniform(32) - 1)),
  407:     do_integer_encoding(I2, Src, Data),
  408:     do_integer_encoding(N-1, I1, Src, Data).
  409: 
  410: do_integer_encoding(I, Src, Data) ->
  411:     Str = integer_to_list(I),
  412:     io:put_chars(Src, [Str,",\n"]),
  413:     io:put_chars(Data, [Str,",\n"]).
